intro: Ruellia verticillata, commonly known as the whorled ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers in whorls at the ends of its stems, which bloom from summer to fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Ruellia verticillata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
